I found the root cause! The issue is in the React.useMemo dependency array. Every time the player moves, setStableMazeRef creates a completely new array reference, which causes React.useMemo to re-render ALL cells, including diamonds and other objects that haven't actually changed.

Let me examine the current memoization logic:

App.tsx 520 - 551
Perfect! I've identified the exact problem. The current implementation creates a new array reference every time the player moves:

setStableMazeRef([...gameState.maze.map((row) => [...row])]);
This causes the React.useMemo to think the entire maze has changed, so it re-renders ALL cells, causing the flickering of diamonds and other objects.

The solution is to implement a more intelligent memoization strategy that only re-renders cells that have actually changed. Here's my fix:
